midas/examples/epics/shareLib.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002  * Use compiler specific key words to set up shareable library
00003  * external symbols and entry points
00004  *
00005  * Right now this is only necessary for WIN32 DLL, and to a lesser extent VAXC.
00006  * The approach should be general enough for future systems, however.
00007  *
00008  *
00009  * USAGE:
00010  *
00011  * In header files, declare variables, classes and functions
00012  * to be __exported__ like this:
00013  *
00014  *      epicsShareFunc int epicsShareAPI 
00015  *                      a_func (int arg);       function prototype
00016  * or
00017  *      epicsShareFunc int epicsShareAPIV 
00018  *                      a_func (int arg, ...);  variable args function prototype
00019  *                                                (using either ... or va_list)
00020  *      epicsShareExtern  int a_var;            reference variable
00021  *                                                (reference declaration)
00022  *      epicsShareDef int a_var= 4;             create variable instance
00023  *                                                (definition declaration)
00024  *      class epicsShareClass a_class;          reference a class 
00025  *
00026  * Usually the epicsShare... macros expand to
00027  *  "import this from a DLL"  (on WIN32, on Unix it's a NOOP)
00028  *
00029  * In the implementation file, however, you write:
00030  *
00031  *  #include <routines_imported.h>
00032  *  #include <routines_imported_from_other_dlls.h>
00033  *  #define epicsExportSharedSymbols
00034  *  ! no more includes specifying routines outside this DLLs from here on ! 
00035  *  #include <shareLib.h>
00036  *  #include <in_this_dll_but_not_implemented_in_this_file.h>
00037  *  #include <what_I_implement_in_this_file.h>
00038  *
00039  * The point is: define epicsExportSharedSymbols exactly and only
00040  * right before you include the prototypes for what you implement!
00041  * Then include shareLib.h again because this is where they get changed.
00042  * This time the epicsShare... macros expand to
00043  *  "export this from the DLL that we are building". (again only on WIN32)
00044  *
00045  * NOTE:
00046  * If what_I_implement_in_this_file.h includes header files for routines that
00047  * are not implemented in the DLL, then you will need to force these
00048  * header files to be included before setting epicsExportSharedSymbols,
00049  * including shareLib.h, and including what_I_implement_in_this_file.h. Since
00050  * all well written header files have "ifdef" guards against multiple inclusion
00051  * this is only a matter of "preincluding" the headers for these DLL
00052  * imports before epicsExportSharedSymbols is defined. This
00053  * is admittedly a bit of a mess, but is fortunately only the concern of
00054  * persons who are adding routines to a library, and will have no impact
00055  * on persons using routines out of a library.
00056  *
00057  *      8-22-96 -kuk-
00058  */
00059 
00060 #undef epicsShareExtern
00061 #undef epicsShareDef
00062 #undef epicsShareClass
00063 #undef epicsShareFunc
00064 #undef epicsShareAPI
00065 #undef epicsShareAPIV
00066 #undef READONLY
00067 
00068 /*
00069  * if its WIN32 and it isnt the Cygnus GNU environment
00070  * (I am assuming Borlund and other MS Vis C++ competitors
00071  * support these MS VisC++ defacto standard keywords???? If not
00072  * then we should just switch on defined(_MSC_VER) here)
00073  *
00074  * Also check for "EPICS_DLL_NO" not defined so that we will not use these
00075  * keywords if it is an object library build of base under WIN32.
00076  */
00077 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__CYGWIN32__)
00078 
00079 #       if defined(epicsExportSharedSymbols)
00080 #               if defined(EPICS_DLL_NO)        /* this indicates that we are not building a DLL */
00081 #                       define epicsShareExtern extern
00082 #                       define epicsShareClass
00083 #                       define epicsShareFunc
00084 #               else
00085 #                       define epicsShareExtern extern __declspec(dllexport)
00086 #                       define epicsShareClass  __declspec(dllexport)
00087 #                       define epicsShareFunc  __declspec(dllexport)
00088 #               endif
00089 #       else
00090 #               if defined(_DLL)        /* this indicates that we are being compiled to call a DLL */
00091 #                       define epicsShareExtern extern __declspec(dllimport)
00092 #                       define epicsShareClass  __declspec(dllimport)
00093 #                       define epicsShareFunc  __declspec(dllimport)
00094 #               else
00095 #                       define epicsShareExtern extern
00096 #                       define epicsShareClass
00097 #                       define epicsShareFunc
00098 #               endif
00099 #       endif
00100         /*
00101          * Subroutine removes arguments 
00102          * (Bill does not allow __stdcall to be next to
00103          * __declspec(xxxx))
00104          */
00105 #       define epicsShareAPI __stdcall
00106         /*
00107          * Variable args functions cannot be __stdcall
00108          * Use this for variable args functions
00109          * (Those using either ... or va_list arguments)
00110          */
00111 #       define epicsShareAPIV __cdecl
00112 #       if defined(EPICS_DLL_NO)        /* this indicates that we are not building a DLL */
00113 #               define epicsShareDef
00114 #       else
00115 #               define epicsShareDef __declspec(dllexport)
00116 #       endif
00117 #       define READONLY const
00118 /*
00119  * if its the old VAX C Compiler (not DEC C)
00120  */
00121 #elif defined(VAXC)
00122 
00123         /* 
00124          * VAXC creates FORTRAN common blocks when
00125          * we use "extern int fred"/"int fred=4". Therefore,
00126          * the initialization is not loaded unless we
00127          * call a function in that object module.
00128          *
00129          * DEC CXX does not have this problem.
00130          * We suspect (but do not know) that DEC C 
00131          *      also does not have this problem.
00132          */
00133 #       define epicsShareExtern globalref
00134 #       define epicsShareDef globaldef
00135 #       define READONLY const
00136 #       define epicsShareClass
00137 #       define epicsShareFunc
00138 #       define epicsShareAPI
00139 #       define epicsShareAPIV
00140 
00141 #else
00142 
00143 /* else => no import/export specifiers */
00144 
00145 #       define epicsShareExtern extern
00146 #       define epicsShareAPI
00147 #       define epicsShareAPIV
00148 #       define epicsShareClass
00149 #       define epicsShareDef
00150 
00151 #       define epicsShareFunc
00152 #       if defined(__STDC__)
00153 #               define READONLY const
00154 #       else
00155 #               define READONLY
00156 #       endif
00157 
00158 #endif
